title: Context Harness
description: Local-first context engine for AI tools

title: Demo
description: Search a pre-built knowledge base in your browser

title: Blog
description: Recipes, release notes, and real-world use cases for Context Harness.

title: Recipe: Chat With Your Blog
description: Combine a WordPress connector with a custom agent to create a conversational persona grounded in your own published writing.

title: Recipe: Unified Context for Your Engineering Team
description: Set up a shared Context Harness instance that indexes multiple repos, Jira, runbooks, and ADRs — so every engineer

title: Recipe: Index Your GitHub Issues
description: A Lua connector that pulls issues from any GitHub repo and makes them searchable by your AI tools. Great for bug triage and project context.

title: Recipe: Index Your WordPress Blog
description: Write a 60-line Lua connector that parses a WordPress XML export and turns every post into a searchable document.

title: Local Embeddings on Every Platform
description: Context Harness ships local embeddings on all six release targets — no ORT install, no musl or Intel Mac left behind.

title: v0.2.0: Native MCP Streamable HTTP
description: Context Harness now speaks the MCP protocol natively — connect Cursor, Claude, and other MCP clients directly via URL.

title: v0.3.0: See What Your Index Is Doing
description: New stats, search explain, native JSON export, shell completions, and Docker support — everything you need to actually use Context Harness.

title: v0.4.2: The Extension Registry Is Here
description: The big release: a community extension registry inspired by cheat/cheat — one command, dozens of connectors and tools. Plus local embeddings on every binary and the build fixes that made it ship.

title: Documentation
description: Everything you need to install, configure, extend, and deploy Context Harness.

description: Ingest data from any source and extend agents with custom Lua-scripted tools.

description: Filesystem, Git, and S3 connectors for ingesting data from any source.

description: Define custom MCP tools in Lua that AI agents can discover and call at runtime.
